page.title: 01Gazeteer One
page.content: This block covers downland, a rapidly expanding residential area, a valley, a river, farms, and villages. It is south of Lewes and north of Newhaven on the East Sussex coast. The South Downs are protected from new building by restrictive orders. Piddinghoe does have more recent development (not welcomed by all the residents). The valley provides rail and road connections to Newhaven. Farming in the area is changing from dairy herds to arable crops, though Halcombe Farm has battery hens. The coastal residential strip between Brighton and Eastbourne is a desirable area for retirement as well as for workers prepared to commute to London. Peaceheaven has expanded in recent years with private developments such as Strawberry Hill. Shopping facilities are nearby in the Meridian centre.
